document_data.name: Ghargatula
document_data.subtype3e: [[Baatezu]], [[:Category:Creatures with the evil subtype|evil]], [[:Category:Creatures with the lawful subtype|lawful]]
document_data.first: ''[[Book of Vile Darkness (sourcebook)|Book of Vile Darkness]]''
document_data.mainbody: '''Ghargatulas''' were massive, ferocious [[baatezu]] [[devil]]s sometimes used to guard important locations.
document_data.Description: Ghargatulas towered at {{SI|25|ft|long=yes}} tall, and could easily be mistaken for [[dragon]]s or [[Fiendish creature|fiendish]] [[dinosaur]]s at first by their sheer size alone. However, their actual shape revealed that they were no such thing; no hint of a [[drake]]'s grace or structure could be found in the bipedal mound of a ghargatula's form, their dark, jagged, almost craggy flesh mirroring the hellish wastelands in which they dwelt. Dozens of mismatched, many-jointed arms covered their bodies, each sporting one or more claws, and each had a prehensile, {{SIAdj|15|ft|adj=long}} tail ending in a stinger [[coal]]-black with venom. Most striking of all was the massive maw that took up most of a ghargatula's head, housing its dagger-sized teeth, short-sword length tusks, and fetid breath.
document_data.Personality: Ghargatulas were deadly but dim creatures which, unless put to work, would kill anything they came across, including other devils.
document_data.Abilities:
A ghargatula could engulf an entire human in their maws with one bite, swallowing them whole, and keep larger creatures pinned in their mighty jaws. They also had the common devilish resistances, as well as regenerative powers stopped only by [[Holy (weapon quality)|holy]] or [[Bless weapon|blessed]], enchanted weapons. If one managed to cut their way out of their innards, muscular action would close the hole, forcing a newly trapped individual to carve out a new one. Their tails whipped around their massive bodies and delivered a poison that impaired one's ability to move.

Like other devils, ghargatulas had [[telepathic]] abilities and the ability to summon other baatezu. However, unlike their kin, they were generally lacking in magic powers, and their attempt to summon was weak, with only a one-in-four chance of calling a [[cornugon]] once per day.
document_data.Combat: Lacking the magic of other baatezu, ghargatula were straightforward yet incredibly savage combatants, relying on their sheer physical power in combat. They compressed their ungainly form to better attack smaller prey, squatting low to snap at them with their jaws.
document_data.Ecology: If not wandering the warmer layers of [[Hell]] causing carnage, ghargatulas were employed to protect the significant places of Baator, such as palaces and cathedrals,
document_data.Biology: Ghargatulas, like other baatezu, had [[darkvision]] able to penetrate [[deeper darkness]]. Their keen sense of smell allowed them to locate hidden foes (including [[Invisibility|invisible]] ones) immediately and track by smell, though not differentiate between copies in the same relative area, such as those made through [[illusion]] magic.
